allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat\(wechat\): add WeChat 4.x channel extension and bridge

- Add extensions/wechat: TypeScript extension for WeChat channel
  - channel.ts: WeChat channel implementation
  - gateway.ts: WebSocket gateway for wxauto-bridge
  - config.ts: Configuration management
  - types.ts: Type definitions

- Add wxauto-bridge: Python bridge for WeChat 4.x
  - wechat_handler.py: WeChat automation using pyautogui
  - bridge.py: WebSocket server for communication
  - Support for sending and receiving messages
  - Uses double-click + Ctrl+C for message reading
  - Uses Ctrl+F search for opening chats

Note: WeChat 4.x uses Qt framework which doesn''t expose
UI Automation controls, so we use keyboard/mouse simulation
instead of uiautomation library.
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
refactor\(wechat\): use wxauto library for WeChat 3.x support

- Refactor wechat_handler.py to use wxauto library instead of pyautogui
- wxauto provides proper UIAutomation support for WeChat 3.x
- Remove debug files and test scripts
- Update requirements.txt with wxauto dependencies
- Update README.md to note WeChat 3.x requirement

Note: WeChat 4.x uses Qt framework which doesn''t support UIAutomation,
so this implementation requires WeChat 3.x version.
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
refactor\(wechat\): change bridge to WebSocket client architecture

- wxauto-bridge now acts as WebSocket client, connecting to OpenClaw Gateway
- Uses JSON-RPC 2.0 protocol for communication
- Supports automatic reconnection on connection loss
- Implements all required methods: send, sendFile, getStatus, addListen, etc.
- Pushes messages via wechat.message, wechat.status, wechat.connected

Architecture change:
- Before: Bridge was WebSocket server, OpenClaw connected to it
- After: Bridge is WebSocket client, connects to OpenClaw Gateway

This aligns with the design in WECHAT-EXTENSION-DESIGN.md
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat\(wechat\): add WebSocket server for bridge connections

Architecture changes:
- Add WeChatBridgeServer class to handle incoming bridge connections
- Register /channels/wechat WebSocket endpoint in Gateway
- Use JSON-RPC 2.0 protocol for communication
- Support wechat.connected, wechat.message, wechat.status notifications
- Support send, sendFile, getStatus, addListen, removeListen commands

Gateway changes:
- Add pluginUpgradeHandlers support to attachGatewayUpgradeHandler
- Export registerWsUpgradeHandler from server-runtime-state
- Export WsUpgradeHandler type from plugin-sdk

This enables wxauto-bridge to connect as a WebSocket client to
OpenClaw Gateway, aligning with the design in WECHAT-EXTENSION-DESIGN.md
EOF
\)")
Bash(start /B cmd /c "pnpm openclaw gateway run --bind loopback --port 18789 --force > gateway.log 2>&1")
Bash(bun run src/cli/index.ts gateway run --bind loopback --port 18789 --force --verbose)
